verses.roman:
tāṅhā ba-i viśve kichu nāhi dekhi āra
ataeva 'viśvarūpa' nāma ye tāṅhāra

synonyms: tāṅhā ba-i—except Him; viśve—within this cosmic manifestation; kichu—something; nāhi—there is none; dekhi—I see; āra—further; ataeva—therefore; viśvarūpa—universal form; nāma—name; ye—that; tāṅhāra—His.
translation: The gigantic universal form is called the Viśvarūpa incarnation of Mahā-saṅkarṣaṇa. Thus we do not find anything within this cosmic manifestation except the Lord Himself.
